title: Pairing New or Replacement Keys

body.body: Obtain all available motorcycle keys from the owner.
Power the motorcycle ON using a paired key.
Refer to the following guidelines for advice on which key to use to power the motorcycle ON:
Guidelines - Replacing a Lost Smart Key
Guidelines - Adding a Second Smart Key
Navigate to DIAGNOSTICS - IMMOBILISER/KEYLESS ECM DIAGNOSTICS - Configure.
Before clicking Re-Register All Keys, ensure that you have all keys being paired to hand.
A ten minute (600 second) security time delay is then initiated for the first key pairing. Do not leave the motorcycle unattended during this time.

During the ten minute (600 second) time delay, the pairing of the key used to power the motorcycle ON is retained. It is therefore not necessary to re-pair this key. All other paired keys are registered as inactive.

After the ten minute (600 second) time delay has elapsed, a pairing command is transmitted by the Low Frequency (LF) antenna. The Triumph diagnostic tool will prompt you to position the key being paired against the LF antenna.
The LF antenna is located at the rear of the motorcycle behind the right hand rear side panel. For pairing purposes, hold the key against the lower edge of the curve in the panel.
Only allow one key to be brought into close proximity of the LF antenna during each key pairing.
Further keys can be paired by clicking Add. A five minute (300 second) time delay is applied to each subsequent key pairing.
A ten minute (600 second) security time delay will begin.
When the time delay has elapsed, place the key against the LF antenna as prompted by the Triumph diagnostic tool.
LF antenna location until the Triumph diagnostic tool reports the key has been successfully paired.
Click Add to pair another key in the same way or click Finish to end the process.
Smart keys should be positioned so that the side with the logo/button is facing away from the
If pairing does not occur immediately, slowly adjust the position of the key to the LF antenna (keeping it in close proximity) until the pairing is achieved.
Pairing New or Replacement Keys Illustration fragment - PB1; PJ1; PJZ
Smart key led indicator (shown powered on)

search: Pairing New or Replacement Keys
Obtain all available motorcycle keys from the owner.
Remove the rider’s seat.
Power the motorcycle ON using a paired key.
Refer to the following guidelines for advice on which key to use to power the motorcycle ON:
Guidelines - Replacing a Lost Smart Key
Guidelines - Adding a Second Smart Key
Connect the Triumph diagnostic tool.
Navigate to DIAGNOSTICS - IMMOBILISER/KEYLESS ECM DIAGNOSTICS - Configure.
Before clicking Re-Register All Keys, ensure that you have all keys being paired to hand.
A ten minute (600 second) security time delay is then initiated for the first key pairing. Do not leave the motorcycle unattended during this time.

During the ten minute (600 second) time delay, the pairing of the key used to power the motorcycle ON is retained. It is therefore not necessary to re-pair this key. All other paired keys are registered as inactive.

After the ten minute (600 second) time delay has elapsed, a pairing command is transmitted by the Low Frequency (LF) antenna. The Triumph diagnostic tool will prompt you to position the key being paired against the LF antenna.
The LF antenna is located at the rear of the motorcycle behind the right hand rear side panel. For pairing purposes, hold the key against the lower edge of the curve in the panel.
Only allow one key to be brought into close proximity of the LF antenna during each key pairing.
Further keys can be paired by clicking Add. A five minute (300 second) time delay is applied to each subsequent key pairing.
Click Re-Register All Keys.
A ten minute (600 second) security time delay will begin.
When the time delay has elapsed, place the key against the LF antenna as prompted by the Triumph diagnostic tool.
Hold the key against the
rear
LF antenna location until the Triumph diagnostic tool reports the key has been successfully paired.
Click Add to pair another key in the same way or click Finish to end the process.
Smart keys should be positioned so that the side with the logo/button is facing away from the
rear
LF antenna.
If pairing does not occur immediately, slowly adjust the position of the key to the LF antenna (keeping it in close proximity) until the pairing is achieved.
